name: Cragmaw Castle
description: Ruined castle of 7 crumbling towers. Upper levels collapsed. Only ground floor habitable. Ancient stronghold of wizard-noble from Phalorm, now goblin fortress.
atmosphere: Centuries of decay. Crude goblin repairs with timbers shore up weakest areas. Structure ready to collapse completely. King Grol's domain.
location_in_world: ~20 miles NE of Cragmaw Hideout in Neverwinter Wood. Hidden, must learn location from: Reidoth, captured goblin, Agatha, Hamun Kost, or random goblin encounter.

general_features.doors: Wood with iron bands. No locks. DC 15 Str to break if barricaded
general_features.walls: Exterior 5 ft thick (1 ft stone, 3 ft fill, 1 ft stone). Interior 1 ft stone
general_features.arrow_slits: 10 ft above outside, 4 ft above inside, 8 in wide, 4 ft high. Three-quarters cover
general_features.light: Small natural light through slits. Mostly dim/dark

1_castle_entrance.description: 7 crumbling towers of different sizes. Upper stories collapsed. Steps lead to terrace. Pair of sundered bronze doors (corroded, collapsed). Round towers overlook entrance with arrow slits.
1_castle_entrance.tactics: Goblins in area 3 supposed to watch but are lazy. DC varies by party stealth vs goblin passive Perception 9.

2_trapped_hall.description: Foyer with crumbling rubble. Doors N and S. Broad corridor east with dusty rubble and fallen plaster.
2_trapped_hall.trap: Copper tripwire in rubble before area 8 door. Passive Perception 20 or DC 10 active search. Triggers ceiling cave-in: DC 10 Dex save or 3d6 bludgeoning, half on success.

3_archer_post.description: Small room littered with debris. Arrow slit offers field of fire over castle gates.
3_archer_post.enemies: 2 goblins in each (4 total in both towers)
3_archer_post.tactics: Take turns shooting and ducking. Drop bows for melee when party enters room.
features: Fine field of fire over entrance

4_ruined_barracks.description: SW tower is heap of rubble. Ragged bedrolls on remaining floor. Small twisting passage leads east through ruins.
4_ruined_barracks.development: Noise attracts area 7 goblins. One investigates after 1 round.

5_storeroom.description: Old casks of salted meat, sacks of rotting grain. Bloody suit of chain mail, heavy crossbow, longsword with Neverwinter emblem.
5_storeroom.treasure: Small cask dwarven brandy (20 glasses). 1 glass = regain 1 hp, 2 glasses in 1 hour = poisoned for 1 hour
5_storeroom.special: Chain mail and longsword belong to Sildar Hallwinter (grateful if returned)

6_hobgoblin_barracks.description: 4 straw pallets and bedrolls. Weapon racks on walls: spears, swords, morningstars. North wall damaged but floor swept clean.
6_hobgoblin_barracks.tactics: Don't react to goblin noise (always fighting). Quick to defend tower or respond to alarm.
6_hobgoblin_barracks.treasure: 5 spears, 4 longswords, 3 morningstars, 2 greatswords, 1 quarterstaff (engraved feathers, light, 10 gp)

7_banquet_hall.description: Once grand hall, now goblin mess. Western end is rubble wall. 25 ft ceiling. 2 large tables with benches. Brass brazier with glowing coals. Dirty dishes, half-full pots, moldy bread, gnawed bones.
7_banquet_hall.enemies: 7 goblins + Yegg (goblin leader, 12 hp, chief cook)
7_banquet_hall.tactics: Yegg bullies assistants. If Yegg dies, others flee E or W (avoid N door due to trap in area 2).

8_dark_hall.description: High narrow hall (once chapel). Angelic figures sculpted in upper reaches. Heavy curtains block N archways. Cracked ornate stone brazier between archways.
8_dark_hall.tactics: Grick climbs to ledge in shadows (Stealth vs passive Perception). Drops to attack. Knows not to eat goblins unless Lhupo says. Goblins terrified, rush through in groups.
8_dark_hall.religion_check: DC 10 identifies deities: Oghma (knowledge), Mystra (magic), Lathander (dawn), Tymora (luck) - human builders
8_dark_hall.treasure: Gold statuette sun elf in brazier coals (100 gp). Wrapped in crimson cloth. Detect magic = divination aura. Non-evil can ask question (augury effect), once per creature ever.
8_dark_hall.trap: If either eye removed from statue, pillars crack, ceiling collapses. DC 15 Dex save or 4d10 bludgeoning, prone. Half damage on success.

9_goblin_shrine.description: Northern tower. Stone altar with bloodstained black cloth. Golden ritual items: chalice, knife, censer. Heavy curtains on S archways.
9_goblin_shrine.enemies: Lhupo (goblin, 12 hp) + 2 goblin acolytes (in filthy robes over armor, no divine powers)
9_goblin_shrine.tactics: If heard grick fight, hide behind altar for surprise. Otherwise kneeling praying to Maglubiyet.
features: Altar engraved with human gods (same as area 8)
9_goblin_shrine.treasure: Chalice (150 gp), knife (60 gp), censer (120 gp) - human-made

10_postern_gate.description: South side entrance. Overgrown path leads to passage climbing into wall. Large iron door with heavy bands. Arrow slits 10 ft above ground overlook path.
10_postern_gate.locked: DC 15 thieves tools or DC 25 Str
10_postern_gate.arrow_slits: Connect to area 7. Goblins hear activity here if listen. Door noise = alarm.

11_ruined_tower.description: Tower almost completely collapsed. Ground floor has open space. Rotting crates and barrels (old provisions). Heavy curtain blocks crumbling area S. Intact door E. Canvas screen N hides passage through rubble.
11_ruined_tower.secret: Canvas door (DC 15 Perception from outside or DC 10 if searching)
features: Hidden north exit to forest (100 ft)

12_guard_barracks.description: Stone brazier with glowing coals. 4 straw pallets on E wall. South wall collapsed but barred door clear. Curtain in N archway.
12_guard_barracks.tactics: Combat starts = 1 hobgoblin runs to warn King Grol (area 14), returns in 2 rounds. Both fight to death.

13_owlbear_tower.description: Door barred from outside. Upper floors collapsed creating 30+ ft silo. Dust, rubble, broken glass. Old worktables and bookshelves (former library/workshop). Hulking owlbear in center.
13_owlbear_tower.enemies: 1 owlbear (captured by Cragmaws, doesn't know what to do with it)
13_owlbear_tower.tactics: Kept dark to stay calm. Attacks first creature in doorway. If fed meat, eats. Otherwise attacks.
13_owlbear_tower.escape: If door opened and clear path, owlbear flees (most likely through area 11), attacking anything in way.
13_owlbear_tower.treasure: Jagged ledge 15 ft up (DC 15 Perception). Wooden chest: 90 ep, 120 gp, potion healing, scroll silence, scroll revivify

14_king_grol_quarters.description: Crude living space. Thick furs as carpets. Old trophies on walls. Large bed N. Round table with chairs S near door. Brazier burning. Unconscious dwarf on floor (Gundren, badly beaten).
14_king_grol_quarters.enemies: King Grol (bugbear, 45 hp), Snarl (wolf, 18 hp), Doppelganger (disguised as female drow - Vyerith, Black Spider messenger)
14_king_grol_quarters.negotiation: Grol wants to sell map instead of giving to Black Spider. Vyerith wants to question Gundren then kill him and destroy map.
14_king_grol_quarters.tactics: If warned, Vyerith hides behind NE door (ambush from rear). Grol holds Gundren hostage. If Grol dies, Vyerith tries to kill Gundren, grab map, flee to area 11.
14_king_grol_quarters.gundren: Dwarf commoner, unconscious, 0 hp but stable
14_king_grol_quarters.arrow_slits: 15 ft above outside ground. Not watching.
14_king_grol_quarters.treasure: Under Grol's bed mattress: 220 sp, 160 ep, 3 potions healing, MAP TO WAVE ECHO CAVE

returning_war_band.optional_complication: 3 hobgoblins + Targor Bloodsword (hobgoblin, 20 hp) + 2 wolves returning as party leaves
returning_war_band.treasure: 1d4 carry bloody sacks with severed elf heads (trophies)
returning_war_band.negotiation: Targor ambitious. DC 15 Persuasion to convince him Grol's death = his chance to lead tribe. Might spare party.

key_treasure: Map to Wave Echo Cave (under Grol's bed)
advancement: Should be level 4 after clearing castle and rescuing Gundren
